Articles.Content: I feel that the mods link in the main webpage should not only link to CurseForge, but also KerbalStuff and the KSP Forum add-on subforum.
KerbalStuff isn't an official website, though, is it?

No, it's not an official website, but I still think it ought to be linked, as it is a major website. More people seem to be using KerbalStuff than CurseForge. (Although more still are using things like GitHub, which is why there needs to be a forum link)

No, it's not an official website, but I still think it ought to be linked, as it is a major website. More people seem to be using KerbalStuff than CurseForge. (Although more still are using things like GitHub, which is why there needs to be a forum link)

This, to be honest, I like KerbalStuff vast amounts more than Curse. I don't know why, but I just like it's simple, non-cluttered interface more.

I don't know if SQUAD got locked into some contract with Curse, though, so i'm not sure if this will happen.

EVERYONE seems to post their mod links on the forums though, so I suppose that's a universal source (unless i'm wrong and I've been missing out on dozens of mods?)

I don't know either. All I can do is ask Rows about it. Or Kasper. Kasper might be able to make an official declaration one way or the other, seeing as he's officially a Squad employee now...

Edited December 9, 2014 by vexx32

There's unfortunately no official declaration to be had. We've been thinking about revamping the site down the road, so a lot can be considered. I wouldn't look for any definite action on it right now, one way or the other, but thank you for putting your two cents in.

My two cents is that I would like kerbalstuff (for mods) and kerbalX (for craft) linked along with Curse. It does seem a lot of people use GitHub (which is nice) but linking to that would be counter productive IMHO for obvious reasons.
